definition: A location where two or more paths or roads intersect, typically designed for vehicles or pedestrians to cross from one side to another. It is commonly used to describe a specific type of transportation infrastructure.

examples.german: An der nächsten Kreuzung biegen Sie rechts ab.
examples.english: Turn right at the next intersection.

examples.german: Die Kreuzung ist durch Ampeln geregelt.
examples.english: The intersection is regulated by traffic lights.

examples.german: Die Kreuzung befindet sich vor dem Supermarkt.
examples.english: The intersection is located in front of the supermarket.
